content:
Yes, there are several special items and artifacts in UC San Diego Library's Dr. Seuss Collection that are considered highlights. One of the most famous items is a collection of original drawings and sketches from Dr. Seuss's books, many of which have never been seen by the public. Another highlight is a collection of letters between Dr. Seuss and fan mail from children and adults alike, which provide insight into his creative process and the impact he had on his readers. 

One particularly unique item is a collection of Dr. Seuss's hats, which he often wore to events and while writing his books. The hats range from a simple white fedora to a wild, multicolored hat with feathers and tassels. 

Overall, the UC San Diego Library's Dr. Seuss Collection is full of treasures, and there are many highlights to explore.
